alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Haskell; Okmulgee; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 04 at 4:12PM CDT until November 04 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Oklahoma, northeast Oklahoma and southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in east central Oklahoma, Cherokee, Muskogee and Sequoyah. In northeast Oklahoma, Adair, Okmulgee and Wagoner. In southeast Oklahoma, Haskell, McIntosh and Pittsburg. * WHEN...Until 715 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 410 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Radar estimates up to 1 inch of rain has already fallen in parts of the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2.5 inches and locally higher are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Muskogee... Tahlequah... Sallisaw... Stilwell... Eufaula... Stigler... Fort Gibson... Checotah... Warner... Westville... Vian... Gore... Porum... Okay... Webbers Falls... Hulbert... Whitefield... Oktaha... Watts... Marble City... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
